page.title: 10LONG EATON. Background.
page.content: Long Eaton, part of the Borough of Erewash is located mid-way between Nottingham and Derby at the southern end of the River Erewash on the land beside the Trent floodplain. Until the mid 19th century Long Eaton was a small agricultural community, with Sawley, to the west being more important. The rapid expansion of the lace industry in the late 19th century caused startling growth. In 1864 there were 26 lace manufactureres in Long Eaton, in 1912, 173. The building and repair of Railway Wagons, engineering, furniture and other textile industries also grew later to give Long Eaton a broad evonomic base. Long Eaton is now an important service centre for the surrounding villages.
